Method Detail

interfaceIT_7Segment_Display

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_7Segment_Display( DWORD hSession, char* pszData, int nStart );
This function sets the 7 Segment data. You can set individual segment by specifing the segment and the character to display, or you can set sections of segment by specifing the start and passing in the entire string.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
pszData - The data you wish displayed on the 7 segment displays
nStart - The starting segment number. Data will be written starting at this segment.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller. IITAPI_ERR_NOT_ENABLED - The 7 segment functions have not been enabled.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_7Segment_Enable

interfaceIT_7Segment_Display_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_7Segment_Display_std( DWORD hSession, char* pszData, int nStart );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_7Segment_Display

interfaceIT_7Segment_Enable

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_7Segment_Enable( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
This function enables the 7 Segment functions on the controller. You need to call this before you attempt to call any of the other functions that set the state of any of the LED's.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_7Segment_Display

interfaceIT_7Segment_Enable_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_7Segment_Enable_std( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_7Segment_Enable

interfaceIT_Analog_Enable

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Analog_Enable( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
This function enables the analog input control on boards that support this feature. You need to call this before you attempt to retrieve the current value.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Analog_GetValue, interfaceIT_Analog_GetValues

interfaceIT_Analog_Enable_std

Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Analog_Enable

interfaceIT_Analog_GetValue

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Analog_GetValue( DWORD hSession, int nReserved, int* pnPos );
This function retrieves the current value of the analog input. The returned value is 12 bit value indicating the input in relation to GND and board +5v.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
nReserved - Reserved must be 0
pnPos - Pointer to a variable that will receive the current 12 bit value of the analog input.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
IITAPI_ERR_NOT_ENABLED - This function has not been enabled.
IITAPI_ERR_PARAMETER_OUT_OF_RANGE - The reserved parameter is not set to 0.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Analog_Enable, interfaceIT_Analog_GetValues

interfaceIT_Analog_GetValue_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Analog_GetValue_std( DWORD hSession, int nReserved, int* pnValue );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Analog_GetValue

interfaceIT_Analog_GetValues

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Analog_GetValues( DWORD hSession, unsigned char* pbValues, int nValuesSize );
This function retrieves the current values of the 16 channel analog input. The returned values are 8 bit data in relation to GND and board +5v.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
pbValues - A pointer to a unsigned char array of 16 (unsigned char[16]).
nValuesSize - The size of the array you are passing in (needs to be 16).
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
IITAPI_ERR_NOT_ENABLED - This function has not been enabled.
IITAPI_ERR_BUFFER_NOT_LARGE_ENOUGH - Passed array is not large enought.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Analog_Enable, interfaceIT_Analog_GetValue

interfaceIT_Analog_GetValues_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Analog_GetValues_std( DWORD hSession, unsigned char* pbValues, int nValuesSize );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Analog_GetValues

interfaceIT_Bind

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Bind( const char* pController, DWORD* phSession );
You need to call this function to to bind to a controller in order to execute any commands with it. Make sure that when you are finished utilizing the controller that you call the interfaceIT_UnBind() function to release control of the controller.

Parameters:
pController - Pointer to a buffer that contains the name of the controller that you wish to bind to. This name is available from the list of returned controllers of the interfaceIT_OpenControllers() function.
phSession - Pointer to the session handle of the controller you bind to. This handle will be needed in all other functions that communicate with the board.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_CONTROLLERS_NOT_OPENED - The interfaceIT controllers are not opened. You need to call interfaceIT_OpenControllers() first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_POINTER - The pointer passed to hold the session for this bound device is not valid.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_NAME - The controller name that was passed in is not valid.
IITAPI_ERR_CONTROLLER_ALREADY_BOUND - The controller you are trying to bind to is already bound.
IITAPI_ERR_RETRIEVING_CONTROLLER - Unable to find a controller by this name.
See Also:
interfaceIT_OpenControllers, interfaceIT_UnBind

interfaceIT_Bind_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Bind_std( const char* pController, DWORD* phSession );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind

interfaceIT_Brightness_Enable

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Brightness_Enable( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
This function enables the brightness control on board that support this feature. You need to call this before you attempt to set the brightness.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
IITAPI_ERR_ALREADY_ENABLED - The brightness function is already enabled
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Brightness_Set

interfaceIT_Brightness_Enable

interfaceIT_Brightness_Set

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Brightness_Set( DWORD hSession, int nBrightness );
This function sets the brightness of the device. Brightness is calculated on a scale of 0 to 255.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
nBrightness - the brightness level to set the device to (0 - 255)
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
IITAPI_ERR_NOT_ENABLED - The brightness functions have not been enabled.
IITAPI_ERR_PARAMETER_OUT_OF_RANGE - The brightness value is out of range.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Brightness_Enable

interfaceIT_Brightness_Set_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Brightness_Set_std( DWORD hSession, int nBrightness );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Brightness_Set

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_CloseControllers();

interfaceIT_Dataline_Enable

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Dataline_Enable( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
This function enables the dataline functions on the controller. You need to call this before you attempt to call any of the other functions that set the state of any of the datalines.

Parameters:

Returns:

IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.

interfaceIT_Dataline_Set

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Dataline_Set( DWORD hSession, int nDataline, bool bOn = true );
This function sets the state of the specified dataline to on (true) or off (false).

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
nDataline - The dataline which you wish to set the date of
bOn - The new state of the data (on = true, off = false)
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller. IITAPI_ERR_NOT_ENABLED - The 7 segment functions have not been enabled.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Dataline_Enable

interfaceIT_Enable_DeviceChange_Notification_Callback

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Enable_DeviceChange_Notification_Callback( bool bEnable, INTERFACEIT_DEVICE_CHANGE_NOTIFY_PROC pProc );
This function enables the device change notifications via a callback to your software. When any interfaceIT device is inserted or removed you will be notified.
Currently the notificaiton is generic and will just notifiy when any device is inserted or removed. Future version will include a parameter indicating which device was changed.

Parameters:
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
pProc - Pointer to the callback function defined as INTERFACEIT_DEVICE_CHANGE_NOTIFY_PROC (not used if bEnable is 0)
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_ALREADY_ENABLED - The callback has already been enabled.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CALLBACK - The callback function was not specified.

interfaceIT_Enable_DeviceChange_Notification_Callback_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Enable_DeviceChange_Notification_Callback_std( bool bEnable, INTERFACEIT_DEVICE_CHANGE_NOTIFY_PROC pProc );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Enable_DeviceChange_Notification_Callback

interfaceIT_EnableLogging

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_EnableLogging( bool bEnable );
This function enabled function call logging to aid the developer in troubleshooting any calling issues.
When logging is enabled the output file will go to "%appdata%\TEKWorx Limited\interfaceIT API\interfaceIT_API.log"

Parameters:
bEnable - Boolean value to set the logging enabled or disabled
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_ALREADY_ENABLED - The logging is already enabled
IITAPI_ERR_UNKNOWN - Error enabling logging (unknown reason)

interfaceIT_EnableLogging_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_EnableLogging_std( bool bEnable );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_EnableLogging

interfaceIT_GetAPIVersion

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_GetAPIVersion( char* pBuffer, DWORD* dwSize );
Function to retrieve the current version of the API.

Parameters:
pBuffer - Pointer to a buffer that will have the API version information written to.
Passing in a NULL to this parameter will cause the function to retrieve the buffer size (dwSize) that is required to hold the version information.
dwSize - Size of the passed in pBuffer and upon exit will be set to the size of data that was stored in the pBuffer.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_BUFFER_NOT_LARGE_ENOUGH - The buffer to hold the data is not large enought.

interfaceIT_GetAPIVersion_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_GetAPIVersion_std( char* pBuffer, DWORD* dwSize );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_GetAPIVersion

interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo( DWORD hSession, BOARDCAPS* pbc );
This function returns a BOARDCAPS structure containing the information about the supported operations and details of the controller.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that you wish to unbind from. This handle was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind() function.
pbc - Pointer to the BOARDCAPS structure that will contain the information about the controllers supported options and operational data.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind() first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind

interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo_std( DWORD hSession, BOARDCAPS* pbc );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo

interfaceIT_GetDeviceList

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_GetDeviceList( char* pBuffer, DWORD* dwSize, char* pBoardType = NULL );
Populates a buffer with a null delimited list of serial numbers of the connected devices.

Parameters:
pBuffer - Pointer to a buffer that will hold a list of controllers that were opened and available to be bound to. Passing in a NULL to this parameter will cause the function to retrieve the buffer size (dwSize) that is required to hold the list of controllers. The returned list of controllers will be their unique serial numbers seperated by a NULL character and terminated with two NULL characters.
dwSize - Size of the passed in pBuffer and upon exit will be set to the size of data that was stored in the pBuffer.
pBoardType - Optional parameter that allows you to open just a specific controller type. Passing in NULL will open all controllers that are connected to the system. For example if you pass in "32E1" you will open just FDS-SYS1 controllers connected to the systems.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_CONTROLLERS_NOT_OPENED - The interfaceIT controllers are not opened. You need to call interfaceIT_OpenControllers() first.
IITAPI_ERR_PARAMETER_LENGTH_INCORRECT - The passed board type parameter was an invalid length. Board types are all 4 digits (ie. 2396).
IITAPI_ERR_BUFFER_NOT_LARGE_ENOUGH - The buffer to hold the list of controllers is not large enought.
See Also:
interfaceIT_CloseControllers, interfaceIT_OpenControllers, interfaceIT_FreeBuffer()

interfaceIT_GetDeviceList_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_GetDeviceList_std( char* pBuffer, DWORD* dwSize, char* pBoardType = NULL );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_GetDeviceList

interfaceIT_GetTotalControllers

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_GetTotalControllers( int* pnControllerCount );
Returns the total number of controllers in the system

Parameters:
pnControllers - Pointer to a variable that will receive the number of controllers
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_CONTROLLERS_NOT_OPENED - The interfaceIT controllers are not opened. You need to call interfaceIT_OpenControllers() first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_POINTER - Invalid pointer to the the variable to retreive the count.
See Also:
interfaceIT_CloseControllers, interfaceIT_OpenControllers

interfaceIT_LED_Enable

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_LED_Enable( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
This function enables the LED functions on the controller. You need to call this before you attempt to call any of the other functions that set the state of any of the LED's.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_LED_Test, interfaceIT_LED_Set

interfaceIT_LED_Enable_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_LED_Enable_std( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_LED_Enable

interfaceIT_LED_Set

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_LED_Set( DWORD hSession, int nLED, bool bOn = true );
This function allows turning on and off individual LED's

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
nLED - LED number that you wish to set the state of.
bOn - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller. IITAPI_ERR_NOT_ENABLED - The LED functions have not been enabled.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_LED_Test, interfaceIT_LED_Enable

interfaceIT_LED_Test

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_LED_Test( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable = true );
This function will set the LED's to a test state (all on).

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
Returns:

IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller. IITAPI_ERR_NOT_ENABLED - The main function has not been enabled.

interfaceIT_License_GetMachineActivationID

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_License_GetMachineActivationID( char* pBuffer, DWORD* dwSize );
Deprecated. Licensing functions have been deprecated as of version 1.6 of the API

Retrieves the activation id / code used by TEKWorx Limited to activate the API for the machine it is running on.
Passing in a NULL for the pBuffer will return the size of the buffer that needs to be allocated and passed in via the dwSize parameter.
This function should only need to be called once per machine to retrieve the activation ID for TEKWorx Limited

Parameters:
pBuffer - Pointer to a character buffer that is large enought to hold the Activation ID
dwSize - Pointer to a DWORD indicating the size of the passed in buffer.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Success
IITAPI_ERR_BUFFER_NOT_LARGE_ENOUGH - Buffer is not large enough to hold the license code
IITAPI_ERR_ALREADY_LICENSED - The machine license has already been activated.
IITAPI_ERR_GENERATING_ACTIVATIONID - There was an error generating the activation ID
See Also:
interfaceIT_License_SetMachineActivation, interfaceIT_License_IsActivated

interfaceIT_License_GetMachineActivationID_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_License_GetMachineActivationID_std( char* pBuffer, DWORD* dwSize );
Deprecated. Licensing functions have been deprecated as of version 1.6 of the API

Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.

See Also:
interfaceIT_License_GetMachineActivationID

interfaceIT_License_IsActivated

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_License_IsActivated();
Deprecated. Licensing functions have been deprecated as of version 1.6 of the API

Returns if the API has a valid activation in place (machine or product).

Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - The API has a valid activation in place
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_LICENSE - the API does not have a valid activation in place.
See Also:
interfaceIT_License_SetMachineActivation

interfaceIT_License_IsActivated_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_License_IsActivated_std();
Deprecated. Licensing functions have been deprecated as of version 1.6 of the API

Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.

See Also:
interfaceIT_License_IsActivated

interfaceIT_License_SetMachineActivation

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_License_SetMachineActivation( char* pBuffer );
Deprecated. Licensing functions have been deprecated as of version 1.6 of the API

Passes in the activation code retrieved from TEKWorx Limited (based on the Activation ID) allowing for the API to be enabled and activated.
This will need to be called before the controller is opened ever time a new process uses the API. It is up to the application utilizing the API to store this Activation code and pass it in every time.

Parameters:
pBuffer - Pointer to a character buffer that is large enought to hold the Activation ID
dwSize - Pointer to a DWORD indicating the size of the passed in buffer.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Success
IITAPI_ERR_ALREADY_LICENSED - The machine license has already been activated.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_LICENSE - The license code passed in is invalid.
See Also:
interfaceIT_License_GetMachineActivationID, interfaceIT_License_IsActivated

interfaceIT_License_SetMachineActivation_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_License_SetMachineActivation_std( char* pBuffer );
Deprecated. Licensing functions have been deprecated as of version 1.6 of the API

Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.

See Also:
interfaceIT_License_SetMachineActivation

interfaceIT_SetBoardOptions

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_SetBoardOptions( DWORD hSession, DWORD dwOptions );
Function all that allow you to set addition options on a board once you have finished binding to it.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
dwOptions - Specifies the options to set for this bound board.
Currently the only support options are:
  • INTERFACEIT_BOARD_OPTION_CDUKEYS - Required for pre v9 CDU's
  • INTERFACEIT_BOARD_OPTION_FORCE64 - Should be used on all board other than the JetMax MCP, FDS-CONTROLLER-MCP and the IIT-HIO-128-256 board (any board that doesn't have 128 inputs). Required on newer FDS-CONTROLLER-MCP's to allow the relay to function correctly
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind

interfaceIT_SetBoardOptions_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_SetBoardOptions_std( DWORD hSession, DWORD dwOptions );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_SetBoardOptions

interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Callback

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Callback( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable, INTERFACEIT_KEY_NOTIFY_PROC pProc );
This function enables the switch notification via a callback to your software. Every time a switch is pressed you will be notified with the switch number and the direction.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
pProc - Pointer to the callback function defined as INTERFACEIT_KEY_NOTIFY_PROC
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Switch_Get_State

interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Callback_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Callback_std( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable, INTERFACEIT_KEY_NOTIFY_PROC pProc );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Callback

interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Poll

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Poll( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable );
This function enables the switch notification via polling from your software. Every time a switch is pressed it is added to the receive queue until you call the interfaceIT_Switch_Get_Item function which removes it from the queue.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
bEnable - Boolean value to set the enable state (true / 1 enables, false / 0 disables).
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Switch_Get_Item, interfaceIT_Switch_Get_State

interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Poll_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Poll_std( DWORD hSession, bool bEnable );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Poll

interfaceIT_Switch_Get_Item

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Switch_Get_Item( DWORD hSession, int* pnSwitch, int* pnDirection );
This function retrieves the oldest switch notificatio when enabled in polling mode. As switch notification are received they are added to the queue until this call is processed to retrieve the oldes item and then remove it.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
pnSwitch - Pointer to a variable that will hold the oldest switch number notification.
pnDirection - Pointer to a variable that will hold the direction for the oldest switch number notification.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller. IITAPI_ERR_NO_ITEMS - There are no more items in the list.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Poll, interfaceIT_Switch_Get_State

interfaceIT_Switch_Get_Item_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Switch_Get_Item_std( DWORD hSession, int* pnSwitch, int* pnDirection );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Switch_Get_Item

interfaceIT_Switch_Get_State

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_Switch_Get_State( DWORD hSession, int nSwitch, int* pnState );
This function retrieves the current state for the indicated switch (callback and polling mode).

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind call.
nSwitch - The switch number that you wish to get the state for.
pnState - Pointer to a variable that will hold the current state of the indicated switch.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to call interfaceIT_Bind first.
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_CONTROLLER_POINTER - The internal pointer to the controller is invalid. This can occur if the controller is unplugged and a new bind is not completed.
IITAPI_ERR_FAILED - The operation has failed. Typically this is because one of the functions that communicates with the controller returned an error.
IITAPI_ERR_FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE - This feature is not available on this controller. IITAPI_ERR_PARAMETER_OUT_OF_RANGE - The requested switch is out of range for the configuraiton of this controller.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Bind, interfaceIT_GetBoardInfo, interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Callback, interfaceIT_Switch_Enable_Poll

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_Switch_Get_State_std( DWORD hSession, int nSwitch, int* pnState );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_Switch_Get_State

interfaceIT_UnBind

 __declspec( dllimport ) int interfaceIT_UnBind( DWORD hSession );
Call this function to unbind from a controller once you are finished with it. If you do not unbind from a board no other bind operation will succeed because the controller is locked.

Parameters:
hSession - Handle to the session that you wish to unbind from. This handle was returned from the interfaceIT_Bind() function.
Returns:
IITAPI_ERR_OK - Operation was successful
IITAPI_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE - The session handle is invalid. You need to pass the session returned from interfaceIT_Bind().
See Also:
interfaceIT_OpenControllers, interfaceIT_Bind

interfaceIT_UnBind_std

 int _stdcall interfaceIT_UnBind_std( DWORD hSession );
Special declaration for calling from Visual Basic applications.
See Also:
interfaceIT_UnBind
